page.title: 09LLANGADOG RACES.
page.content: For the past 100 years, trotting and galloping races have been held in the village on Easter Monday.Years ago, the races were held on the road, but later moved to a field by Bran River and are now held at Pen y Bont field. Dr Huw Walters J.P.and County Coroner has been the chairman of the committee who organises the races for the past 35 years.About ten races are held during the afternoon and large crowds come from far away to watch the racing.The horses are handicapped by weight in the galloping races,and in the trotting races,the horses are handicapped by time.The jockey either sits on the horse or in a light two wheeled carriage pulled behind the horse.Many people bet on the results of the races and the field looks very colourful with all the tents,marquees, horse boxes and spectators.
